CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1953, pg. 32 reads: "Achievement Day Awards Presented - Awards for humanitarianism were presented by the National Achievement Clubs, Inc., of which Mrs. Alma Illery is founder and president, at the Metropolitan Baptist Church, North Side, on Sunday, June 7. Among those taking part were, left to right, first row: Ray Talbert, Lindy Talbert, Dr. Channing Liem, Ramsay Liem, Jim Levinson, Aaron Levinson, Margaret Brown Hill and Evelyn Gardiner.  Top row: Mrs. Carrie Young, Mrs. S.F. Williman, Mrs. Sara Marcus, Mrs. Kathryn Austin, Mrs. Alma Illery, the Rev. S.L. Spear, Miss Myra A. Johns, Mrs. Raymond Talbert, Mrs. Evelyn Levy, Mrs. John H Brown Sr. and Mrs. Daisy Goodman.  Those who received certificates for humanitarianism are holding them in photo. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, left to right, first row: Ray Talbert, Lindy Talbert, Dr. Channing Liem, Ramsay Liem, Jim Levinson, Aaron Levinson, Margaret Brown Hill, and Evelyn Gardiner; top row: Carrie Young, Mrs. S.F. Williman, Sara Marcus, Kathryn Austin, Alma Illery, the Rev. S.L. Spear, Myra A. Johns, Mrs. Raymond Talbert, Evelyn Levy, Mrs. John H Brown, Sr. and Daisy Goodman, some holding humanitarianism award certificates, standing in Metropolitan Baptist Church, North Side
